Replies.Reply: Every man has a death that's right for him. Every one.
...Of course, this was always going to happen this way.
Hey, Sophie. I got something for you, wanna see?
I'm just kidding.
You're very welcome.
I'm sorry I was away so long this time. I had some complications...
No.
I'm not a man who... It wouldn't be good for you, if I was around all the time.
Do I ever?
Thank you. This was a good one.
...How are you, Harry?
I like the new digs.
Times have changed, Harry. They don't wear skirts anymore.
And...
...I don't see how I can --
I'm not a part of that.
That was a long time ago, Harry.
Nope.
Sorry.
I was thinking that a son, should be more grateful to his father.
You take care of yourself, Harry.
Yes. I'd like to speak to Dean.
No. Just tell him I called.
Hello, Don. They make you drive all the way out here this evening?
No, not yet. Maybe when I do, we'll take it out for a spin. Say hello to the wife for me.
We should all be so lucky.
I'm sorry. My bad.
You keep standing next to that window, maybe you'll be able to tell me.
I don't smoke.
Why the change of security?
Come on...
What the hell...?
Listen to me. Stay here. I'm going to check it out.
Harry, relax. I know what I'm doing.
Come on! If we can get to the roof I can hold them off! Come on!
My condolences.
Looks like you have one.
Your dad worked with my father a long time ago.
So, just paying my respects.
Yeah, he was into all that.
No, thanks. I've got to --
Why?
You're still young. You can do pretty much whatever you please.
Maybe.
Oh?
That all yours?
I'll let myself out.
How much do you weigh?
You're a hundred and twenty-five.
Would you have let her do it?
You didn't answer my question.
Sure. But it's a whole other world when you're personally involved.
Governments, cops, the military...
Sure. But that's instinct. What I'm talking about is up here...
Knowledge of foresight. Intention.
Why did you want me to see that little stunt with your girlfriend?
These aren't your people, are they?
Thanks for the tour. It's been interesting.
Something like that.
Yes, a little.
Am I going to die?
What time is it?
Gonna tell me what the big surprise is?
Maybe it's time you start talking.
What do the police think?
...What do you want?
You tell me.
So what am I doing here?
I'm impressed.
I didn't get the impression you even liked Harry very much.
You want revenge.
Justice?
Jesus, stop your whining.
Corner of sixth and Grand.
And Steve... no more surprises like this, okay?
Stay focused. This is a test.
You want to know about killing, look around.
The act of killing, is an end in itself. Any other motive keeps it from being pure.
No, he's driven, compelled, by his sickness. He's as much the victim as those he kills.
But when you make your own law, you're responsible to no one else but yourself. Maybe you're free...
Do you? This isn't some idea anymore. This is the real thing.
Ever heard the term "Mechanic" used outside of its normal meaning?
What are you thinking?
Maybe I do.
...Times are changing. Security is better trained, more lethal.
In this... there isn't room for those who are outside of it.
An associate.
I'm offering to teach you something that most people can't be taught.
That remains to be seen.
But you're alone in there, aren't you? That's... the prerequisite.
Think it over.
You may never find them.
Too fast.
There are no perfect situations.
You lost control.
...Sometimes.
I have... responsibilities. I have a cat.
Don't be so eager. Open it.
...I am.
It's not good enough to simply follow your Mark and attack him.
That's a beauty.
Most of all, you need to answer this question: "How does this man die here today?"
...Good. Very good.
Don't get cocky.
All right. You did very well.
There's a man behind me. Look up once, then look away. Don't look back.
You got him?
You did good here. Really good.
He owns the watch store.
I've taught you how to kill without anyone knowing there was a murder.
Do you want this? Be very sure.
...School's out.
Who do you think that is, Luna?
It's for a friend.
I'm sorry I was away so long this time. I had some complications --
It's okay. Really. It's okay.
Do you remember, what you wanted to be, when you were a little girl?
I'm sorry, I didn't mean... I was thinking of me.
What happened?
We all gotta make a living.
I saw that in a... I'm sorry, I probably should have asked.
Go ahead.

There's a code, to what we do. It may not be rational, but it matters. The man's name was Harry Xiao. He was a Mechanic. Last year a US Representative died in a fire... along with his wife and two children.
A few months ago, a CEO vacationing in Costa Rica was found dead with his wife. Because the woman was tortured, the authorities believed it was drug related.
Civilian casualties are very effective at hiding intent, but there's a line ---
You should put that behind you now.
You didn't.
But you stopped him.
Now I'm sorry if you got a little scared. But this isn't coaching girl's softball, is it? This is life or death. Every time you go into this, somebody dies.
Every time, it's you or the other man. So stop your crying.
You got what you came for, congratulations. You're done Go back to your friends, your women, your whole beautiful life.
That used to be my front door. Try to close it on the way out.
We should all be so lucky.
You get started. I'll make coffee.
Slow down as soon as you get inside. Security station will be to your left...
Work it again.
Maybe they do.
Falls or jumps?
Nothing. I'm going for a run. You wanna come?
You like it?
Always made me feel... understood.
Come on.
The Mark is a beautiful woman.
Why is he standing here? Wouldn't he get better coverage... here?
He can't see her. Neither of them can.
Bishop.
Run it again.
...This business, it's not like there's a degree you can go get.
work is that some people know who you are and what you do.
A man told his girlfriend, to impress her. The girlfriend told some people she owned money to...
I was young. It took me four months to find the people, another to find the girl, and she gave me the Man. That's how I... "got into it."
Sure. Every day. But I wasn't wired that way.
What about you?
Here we go...
Ready?
Not yet.
Duck...
Hey! Hey! You still here?
nature of the beast.
Hey! You did good in there. You hear me?. It was asking a lot.
...Yup.
That one... is for a special moment. Haven't found it yet.
This could get... interesting.
He's going to be working with me from now on.
Do I need your permission?
The mistake was mine, not the kid's.
Someone I trained. That could be worth a lot to you.
Yes.
The hit, on the woman. What was the reason?
Steve! Steve...!?
Bishop.
Seems that way.
Okay.
What's on your mind?
It's not my birthday.
Who are these people?
Mr. KcKenna has a creative relationship with the truth. I don't actually...
Excuse me...
Hi.
Is he your...?
I know. Go on.
Sorry... Sorry for leaving. I'm just not used to --
What's that?
Steve... thank you.
No, I'm serious. Thank you.
Huh.
Son of a bitch...
Whiskey. Neat. Lots of it.
I'm not going anywhere.
...More.
Look, I'll give you my money, but you have to promise me you won't spend it all on lipstick and tampons.
...Thank you.
There you are.
...US Government. NSA. Very well protected.
You should see the other guy.
This... is liquid Semtex with a built in combustible. Very volatile. Nice and shiny once it dries. But don't... scratch it.
No. That's just to focus the mind.
What do you do?
This one's different. They want it fast, and they don't want it to look like an accident. Someone wants to send a message.
Yes. Like that.
First time for everything.
There's something I haven't told you.
...I broke a rule. I brought you in without asking. So this hit, is a test. Of us, of our arrangement.
If that man is breathing three days from now... then they'll need to make an example of us. Do you understand?
I'm sorry.
For getting you into this --
Get packed.
Fifth floor, corner office.
Glass is three inches thick...
And has laser sensors.
Starting to get it?
Everyone has a death --
You any good with computers?
Did you get it?
Does it make a difference?
Do the angles. Find us a shot.
It's a little late for --
Once I did...
We have a problem...
On your four. You see him?
No. You're the shooter.
You'll know when.
Get in.
Behind you.
Get in front.
Now!
I'm sorry I brought you into this.
It was... It was the only thing I knew how to teach you.
Go!
...Why?
Maybe not.
If it matters, today we killed the man who ordered the hit on your father.
Why'd you kill those other people?
Every man has a death that's right for them. Every one.
"...This was always going to happen this way."
'Evening, Arthur. Got your weekly right here.
What do you say, honey?
See you next week, Arthur.
Don't worry about it, Bishop. You have a good night.
Thank you, Bishop.
Thank you, thank you! Bishop! Mom!

...here's a guy at the top of his game. And yes there were questions about the money: Where did it all go. Were some of his friends less than friendly to the US? But in the end, it's not the feds who catch up with him --
It's that age old adage that boys will be boys. These dangerous hobbies come with the risk of accidents like this --
...Intelligence services can listen to our calls. But what about the rest of the world?

Well, today the answer seems to be 'No" as outrage over the assassination of the Turkish envoy Bahar Miryem has forced the US to reverse its position, now saying that it will not make it support of Turkey's EU bid contingent on its cooperation in the security agreement. Miryem had always advocated for Turkish autonomy from  --
You don't have to apologize. I'm just glad you're here now.
Are you hungry?
I'm sorry. I just... miss you. I never thought I was going to be a "woman who waits." But I do. I wait for you.
Were you in Europe? Africa?
Was there another woman?
Liar. It's alright. I don't mind.
I... I made something for you.
I know. I know.
No. But there's a first time for everything.
Bishop... You all right?
You know who I saw yesterday?
Bradley Fliescher. He and Ginny have this little cottage up the coast they hardly use. I was thinking, maybe next week you and I should go.
You and me, the whole weekend.
Of course why do we need that? We have each other right here.
I know, it's crazy. I don't want to pin you down. I know you need your freedom. I just... sometimes I miss you so much...
What?
I'm sorry. Really, I am. I just... You didn't give me any warning this time.
I'm sorry, Bishop. It won't happen again.
Hey, Bishop. You okay?
No, it's okay. I wanted to be a Marine Biologist. I used to watch those Jaques Cousteau movies and just... dream.
I was beautiful.
Don't worry about it this time. On the house.
Hi... This is strange.
No, just a job.
I have to...
Yes, I just got here. No, not yet.
Hold on, I got him.
Mr. Bishop? Mr. Dean would like a moment of your time.
Arthur? Jesus Christ, Arthur, is that you?
Oh you know, I'm God Damn perfect.
Has it really been that long?
You know what all that is?
That's their money, getting moved, exchanged. Made clean and neat and proper for Uncle Sam. And I have always been extremely careful.
You know what that is? That's a God damn subpoena from the Justice Department. We get a new face in the white house, all of a sudden they want to look at my records.
So I call them up. I say "hey, you guys gotta get your own house in order..."
And? And that's the point!
That's bullshit, Arthur. Your father -- they still talk about the guy like he walked on water. You, they'll listen to. You --
You remember that fishing trip we all took, back in the day. You were, what? About eight, right?
You fell out of the boat...
You got these big eyes like saucers, like you're sure you're gonna drown. Splashing...
I finally had to grab you by the hair, pull you back into the boat.
Well, I'm in the water this time, Arthur. You think it's easy for me to ask? It cuts like hell. But that's what I'm doing.
...Thank you. Thank you.
And here's the prodigal son, arrived to bilk me for ransom.
Steve, this is Arthur Bishop.
No, quite the opposite. Arthur's doing me a little favor.
That's enough.
What's it for?
You ever think of having kids, Arthur?
Wise man. How much?
There. Now go away.
Yeah, this is just a few more days.
You? Yeah, you can earn some money. Get married.
No, it's going to be okay now.
We will take from our children for a lifetime what we would not suffer from another man for an instant.
Well, that's your job now, isn't it?
You ever wonder what the last day of your life will feel like, Arthur?
This turns out alright, I'm going to send you a dozen Thai hookers and a case of Cuban Esplandidos.
You will, my friend. For these, you will.
...What?
Arthur...?
This isn't good, Arthur...
Bishop, those men are armed...
...You.
You bastard. You... Sonofabitch.
Oh God. Oh, Jesus Christ help me.
Please, Arthur, put me out of my misery. Your father...
Please. I'm scared. I'm really god damn scared...
Sorry, gotta do this...
Fire in the restaurant.
Patrols two and five, we're closing down the front entrance.
Hey. Nice to meet you. You work for my father?
So you're a criminal?
Relax, relax. I'm kidding.
I need you to make a donation to Louise's charity. She's mounting some kind of fundraiser and she wants to make sure we do our part.
Thirty thousand.
You know, I can't tell what you're thinking, Mr. Bishop. Usually, I'm very good with that, with people.
Don't be. So what are you thinking?
I agree. I agree. I often wonder why I'm not.
Thank you, dad. Are we going to see you at the house any time soon?
Anything I can do?
Well it's good to meet you Mr.
Yeah, Harry was a popular guy.
Best grief money can buy. Give me a ride home?
Yeah, all of that. Empty limos.
Well, I hope it's what Harry would have wanted. But it's not for me.
You know, what I don't get is you.
So?
So your old man was into all that?
Well, that is refreshingly honest, Mr. Bishop. What about you?
Why is it so comforting, when people surpass even our lowest expectations?
Come on in, meet the crowd.
Please. A favor to me. None of these people even remembered what today was.
Do you believe in fate, Mr. Bishop?
I think maybe we're all doomed to become our fathers. I'll probably die spoiled, corrupt, lonely and alone. Runs in the blood. What would that make you?
You think so? Just chuck all this and go help the children in South America, something like that?
Well look at you, Mr. Bishop.
No, in fact I'm pretty sure that's illegal in this state.
Come on, this way.
You know, I went up there. To where my father died.
Hell of a place to die. Lonely...
If the body is weak, the mind can't be strong.
My girlfriend thinks that my father's death is a good time to kill herself. She thinks I'm not showing the appropriate human reaction.
No, please. You've seen this much.
A friend. Would have thought you'd have started by now.
Okay. I'm here. I'm watching.
No, I know you, Louise. You'll do just about anything if it'll get you enough attention.
Do I?
...Wow.
Mr. Bishop?
If you don't care anything about your life, why should I?
You can help her if you want.

You know what the kick of it is, Louise? If you actually had the stones, then there's be something for us. But in 30 seconds when you run down that path and all of those people go crazy saving your life...
Maybe nothing. Maybe you never really knew me.
Go on, Louise. You'll do fine.
We'll never know, will we?
Everybody dies.
Such as?
Everybody can kill. You take a mother, protecting her child...
Why are you telling me all this?
You know, you're right. You grow up spoiled, rich, like me... Only thing you really learn to recognize in people is when someone wants something from you.
What do you want, Mr. Bishop? What are you doing here?
Yes, it has.
Mr. Bishop! Arthur! Please, I need to speak with you.
I wanna show you something.
I'd rather show you. I know, melodramatic. But I think it'll be worth it to you.

You know what that says? My dad didn't die of a heart attack. I mean, he was dying of a heart attack, but that's not what killed him. The blood flow to his brain was cut off, his brain died before his body. Somebody killed him.

The police? They don't want to hear about this. I mean, they'll look into it. But they don't very much like the idea that they totally missed this one and it'd be just easier for everyone if I would shut the hell up.
They killed him. Here, on the roof of his own building. His own security all around. Why here?
To make a point. That no one's safe. That they can get to anyone, whenever they want to.
I got my black belt in Karate when I was nineteen. I've studied Judo since I was six.
No, you're not. Most people are, but you're not. If I came at you right now, I'd wind up dead as my father, wouldn't I?
Same as if I tried to exact justice for my father. These men, what this is... It's something you know about, isn't it?
Something you could teach me.
You really going to stand there and judge how much I loved my father?
Besides, this isn't just about Harry. Harry's dead, may he rest in peace. But this is about me.
You know the word "Nemesis"? It's not actually a word. It's a name.
The executor of divine justice.

Fine. Fine. In case you haven't noticed, I now have a couple of million dollars to spend on this, so I will find them myself and I'll deal with them myself and if I wind up dead trying, you can bury me right next to dear old dad --
I won't.
The psychopath has no motive.
I understand.
I am.
My father used it. A dealer... a guy who works the tables.
Or a... killer. A hit man.
I had you pegged as... a security consultant. Maybe ex-military.
Or maybe you just get paid to kill people.
So why let me in? I mean, I know what I want. What do you get out of it?
Bullshit.
You need a... friend?
Because you think I'm a natural.
Bishop...
When I find the men who murdered my father. You help me to kill them.
You didn't answer my question.
I know. I'm working on it.
What am I supposed to do?
like?
Come on up, man. The view is beautiful.
You think?
You ever think about just... going?
Why don't you?
You know, looking at these, a person might think maybe there's a screw or two loose up there...
Is this what I think it is?
Who's the Mark?
Good? That's all you got? How about God damn perfect, man?
Broad daylight. A thousand witnesses. Man takes a wrong step.
What's that? You're what? Oh, you are impressed? No, come on, you don't have to say that. Really, I'm fine with -- You what? You've never seen someone better? Wow.
Damn straight I did. And now, in celebration of me, I'm taking you to a restaurant where the waitresses... what?
...Bishop?
Yeah. Look...
Who is he?
I know. I meant... what did he do?
Bishop...
No. I'm ready.
Bishop... We're right here, where you wanted us to wind up. You knew where I'd hit you, didn't you?
...Can I ask you a question?
Are you surprised to see me?
Guy owns a watch-store, yet keeps a million dollar apartment.
Was that the man who killed my father?
Bishop! --
I don't give a damn about that!
I could have died today!
Blind fucking luck! Look at me!
Fuck you! You sonofabitch! Give me one good reason I don't blow you away right now! ONE GOD DAMN  REASON!
Bishop. Those things... they don't mean anything to me. This, makes sense. I don't know why. But I think I was meant to do this.
And like you said, you could use someone.
Bishop... Nemesis. Devine Retribution. ...What did she do?
Okay. Okay. Forget I asked.
Sixteen, no, eighteen. Four second intervals.
Make that four and a half seconds.
These guys are packing Israeli-made Uzis. Couple are actual military.
She never leaves. It's like they know we're coming.
Falls off the rooftop.
I tell you one thing, killing her is not the first thing that jumps to mind... what?
Let me ask you something. You ever not feel like running 5 miles?
I don't know. Feels disturbed.
...He can't see her.
How'd you get into it?
You ever wish you just... walked away? Let it go?
Hey! You need to get out! Whole building is going up!
How did it go --
Alright, you gotta admire that.
It's like one moment we're there...
...we're fucked.
There wasn't any sign of this on the plans. I went over them fifty times!! This isn't supposed to be here! This can't be here!
Bishop... what do we do!?
...It was my fault. I was in charge of the exit. I looked at every work order, every entry in the building logs...
You're bleeding.
So back there. That was one hundred percent?
Do you think you know it, when you've made the mistake you won't survive? Or will it be like the Marks? Wake up on top of the world, never know...
...Oh my God. This is a signed Hendrix Axis, 1967 release. This has gotta be worth... we have to play this. You have to play this.
You haven't found the... Are you kidding? You have to -- what?
Do it. I don't care what it costs.
You're still alive.
Hey, can you meet me? Something I want to talk with you about.
There you are. Thanks for coming.
When was the last time you celebrated your real birthday?
See? You're overdue, buddy.
They think you're a friend of mine, a producer, from Canada.
In other words, they're all your best friends.
Oh, he makes the really violent, disturbing stuff. You wouldn't know it to look at him, I know, but what's locked up away in there...
Frightening, man.
Yes, Mr. Bishop. What do you do?
Come on, Mr. Bishop. We're all waiting.
Ladies and gentlemen! The man of the hour!
I know that not many of you know my friend. My good, dear... friend.
Happy birthday, Arthur.
Hey, you forgot something.
No worries, man. It's your party.
This thing we do. Finally, you always do it alone.
Uh-oh. I can feel some male bonding coming. We gonna hug it out, Bishop?
Happy Birthday, Arthur.
Are you all having fun!
I despise each and every one of you!
Give me a moment. I'll be right there. We'll do that amazing E.
Hello? Bishop?
So who is he?
What happened to you?
What's that?
So that's how we take him out?
You makes bombs to focus your mind.
Like with my father.
Didn't think that was your style.
Jesus...
What?
So what you're saying is you and I are stuck with each other.
...For what?
I knew what I was doing.
...I count six... no seven at the main door.
Jesus they've got US Marines in there. Two at the door, one...
... Alright, got him. He's at his desk. We could take the shot right from here.
Alright, fine. What are we doing here? Who is this guy?
Yeah, I'm getting that this isn't a job. It's just a really complicated... suicide.
You know, you can front sonofabitch all you want, Bishop. You're scared, too. You don't really know how we're going to pull it off, do you? You ever think there's some things that just can't be done?
Really? Because, this guy? I look at this guy, I don't see his death.
And you know, as much as I like the quality time, unless you can read lips, I don't exactly see what we're doing here...
You read lips.
Everybody out. I'm serious. Get the fuck off my property.
You, too.
It's the US Attorney's office in New York. He's running. He's trying to get out.
Do you think we're hitting him because of what he's done, or because he's trying to get away with what he's done?
...No, I don't suppose it does.
Security's going to have the actual street locked down. But there's a residential street, perpendicular.
High-end people. They'll put up with a sweep, but they're not going to allow an agent to spend the day.
Besides, the angle isn't right, too flat. Except when they hit the stairs. It'll spread the group vertically. It's... the shot.
You ever worry about the right and wrong of it all? I'm not talking about God, just...
Whatever you feel here.
Come on. You're telling me you've never done anything just because it was the right thing to do, even if it didn't make any sense? You never took a chance like that?
How'd that work out for you?
There's no shot. What do we do?
Bishop...?
When?
Thanks.
Working on that...
We have got to go!
You go for it, I'll cover you.
Not now, Bishop, we have to --
Don't worry about it, Bishop. I brought myself into this.
You don't know?
Cover me.
You know, when they came to me... I said "Are you sure?" Bishop?" But They're right, aren't they?
...You don't really like the work anymore.
Yeah. That's... what did you call it? That's a prerequisite.
Besides, I guess I had other reasons.
Yeah, but not the man who actually killed him.
You really going moral high ground on me? Seriously? You might want to check your soapbox there, partner.
But that's the difference between us, isn't it? You're all alone, but you still... like people. You wish they liked you. Whereas I have people everywhere... and all I ever want, is to be alone.
There's no weapons in there, Bishop! I've... what did you teach me? I've controlled the situation.
you and call you a great and generous man.
Arthur. Glad you're here. Right this way.
This way.
Zak is almost finished. It will make a wonderful addition to your collection.
Do you want to meet him?
That's the job.
You find tires for that old FleetMaster?
Will do. Good night, Arthur.
Bishop. I heard you called. Hey, you get the stuff I sent you?
Hold on a second.
Hey, Bishop. Catch you at a bad time?
You look like shit.
How does Harry McKenna's son figure in?
You sure that's wise?
No... And for the record, I don't believe you'd ask for it.
That was my baby. But my baby has turned into an epic shit-storm and so when the man who caused said epic shit storm suddenly decides to do some soul-searching...
What are you doing, Bishop?
I DON'T CARE.
I am on some very fucking thin ice right now which means you are on some very fucking this ice as well.
And here I thought we were both going to live forever.
You know, in this business, you only get one mistake.
So nothing more like that. You take full responsibility.
Hey, Stanley. Yes, we're all sorted out. I just need you to --
I'm calling you back.
You know, this foul-up, McKenna's son, it's all got some people's panties in a real twirl.
This isn't the time for questions.
Yeah, get me Stan again...
Look, I don't care. Find her, I need to talk to her right now...
Hey... Listen, I need you to go out of town for a few days. No, I know, but you have to trust me.
Just go -- no, don't tell me where.
...Bishop?
BISHOP'S VOICE Send your people home. I don't want anyone I don't know near you today. I'm serious.

His good works comfort all of us, even in his going. We commit his remains to your earth, oh Father, and we pray you vouchsafe him eternal life and that you bring comfort to those who have been left behind. His only son, Steve, who is himself devoted to --
...Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost...
Steve! Steve, man. It's Louise.
She's up in the bungalow. I think she might really do it this time.
Who's he?
This isn't about me. It's about you. You need to watch.
You don't believe I'll do it.
You think you can hide behind that cool attitude. Like nothing matters to you. But I know you.
How long will it take?
A hundred and ten.
He'll stop it. He thinks he's above it all. But he's not. No one is.
Steve! Steve! I know you feel this. I know you'll stop me.
I'm getting cold. Please. I'm frightened. I'm scared, Steve.
You're a bastard.
What happened to you?
You're a bastard, too. Both of you. Like looking in some dark mirror.
Come on, baby. What's the matter?
Hey! Hey baby! Karen's got some amazing E. You need to come try...
Come on, Steve. We need you.
Steve...? Where are you, baby?
Steve, baby...?
Hey, you. Jesus, what a night. We went to opening of Fernando's new restaurant and Betty was there wearing -- well, whatever we call those things she wears...
I miss you. Everybody says hi, of course. But with me... it's like I feel you there with me, even when you're not.
I feel the way you touch me...
Quite a collection you have here.
Does this hurt?
Any next of kin, anybody we can notify?
How about an acquaintance?
No, not today.
You damaged your deltoid muscle.
Any unusual stress recently?
You can pay at the desk.
Interest you in anything?
You know your instruments...
Who... are... you?
They don't make that anymore.
Excuse me, 'mam. There's a fire next door, nothing to worry about.
SURPRISE!
So what movies have you made?
God, I love those. Which ones --
Oh, okay. That's funny. So what do you do?
That's too much.
Dude, you don't want any more, give us that money.
Almost at the same exact moment, the men switch their aim back to each other. Both men, controlling emotion and body.
...Something is wrong in this country. But today because of the actions of a few cowardly men, we may never know the true face of --
